results.adx_keywords: Colon and Colorectal Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Clinical Trials;Research;Immunotherapy;American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;GlaxoSmithKline PLC
results.title: A Cancer Trial’s Unexpected Result: Remission in Every Patient
results.abstract: The study was small, and experts say it needs to be replicated. But for 18 people with rectal cancer, the outcome led to “happy tears.”

media.caption: Sascha Roth, the first patient in the trial, unexpectedly learned she had rectal cancer in 2018. Her gastroenterologist, she recalled, told her during a sigmoidoscopy, “Oh no. I was notexpecting this!”

results.title: Mongols Motorcycle Club Says Its Leader Was an Informant
results.abstract: The biker group hopes to set aside a $500,000 racketeering conviction, alleging that its former president cooperated with the government during a trial.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);United States Economy
results.title: Twilight of the NIMBY
results.abstract: Suburban homeowners like Susan Kirsch are often blamed for worsening the nation’s housing crisis. That doesn’t mean she’s giving up her two-decade fight against 20 condos.

media.caption: Susan Kirsch in her backyard, just a few hundred feet from the site where Phil Richardson hopes to build a multi-unit housing development.

results.abstract: For Sweden and Finland, which want to join NATO, the U.S.S. Kearsarge is a promise of the protection that membership in the alliance would bring against President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

results.title: The War in Ukraine May Be Impossible to Stop. And the U.S. Deserves Much of the Blame.
results.abstract: A tragic, local and ambiguous conflict has been turned into a potential world conflagration.

media.caption: Ukrainian fighters of the Odin Unit, including some foreign fighters, survey a destroyed Russian tank in Irpin, Ukraine, in March.

results.title: Rafael Nadal, Looking Unbeatable, Wins 14th French Open Title
results.abstract: Nadal extended his men’s singles record of 22 Grand Slam tournament titles with a win in straight sets over the eighth-seeded Casper Ruud.

results.title: Ann Turner Cook Dies at 95; Her Face Sold Baby Food by the Billions

media.caption: Ann Turner Cook in 2004, with a copy of a charcoal drawing of her as an infant used on Gerber baby food products.

results.title: In San Francisco, Democrats Are at War With Themselves Over Crime
results.abstract: Fueled by concerns about burglaries and hate crimes, San Francisco’s liberal district attorney, Chesa Boudin, faces a divisive recall in a famously progressive city.

media.caption: Residents who are working to recall Chesa Boudin, the San Francisco district attorney, rallied in the neighborhood of North Beach.

results.title: A Mental Health Clinic in School? No, Thanks, Says the School Board
results.abstract: American teenagers are reporting severe levels of anxiety and depression. But when Connecticut moved to expand mental health services in schools, it ran into fierce opposition in one town.

media.caption: Jasmine Berti, a resident of Killingly, Conn., demonstrated outside the town hall before a Board of Education meeting last month to discuss expanding the high school’s mental health services.

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Budget Travel;Summer (Season);States (US);Content Type: Service
results.title: Go Here, Not There: Vacation Alternatives for the Budget-Conscious
results.abstract: As inflation puts a crimp in travelers’ plans, here are some affordable suggestions for trips focused on wine, culture, food, the outdoors and more.

media.caption: In the Caribbean, St. Lucia, with its volcanic peaks and lush jungles, is reminiscent of Hawaii, and, especially in the late spring and summer shoulder season, is decidedly more affordable.

results.abstract: In this post-#MeToo moment, misogyny and celebrity go hand in hand.

results.title: CNN Enters the Post-Jeff Zucker Era. Bye-Bye ‘Breaking News’ Banners.
results.abstract: Chris Licht, the new CNN chairman, is encouraging a more nuanced approach to coverage. Some at the network are skeptical.
